page.content: weather like they have always had to. Better seeds and improved fertilizers have helped farmers grow a lot more food. Mr. Farnsworth said that "in his lifetime yields had improved 300%". We thought that this was good, but Mr. Farnsworth said that too much food production in the Common Market is causing problems. We thought that farmers worked hard and Mr. Farnsworth agreed with us. He said that he worked about ten hours a day, depending on the weather and what had to be done. His work is very varied. Sometimes a farmer has to be a veterinary surgeon, scientist, manager or mechanic. Good machinery means that nowadays he can plough sixteen acres a day but years ago when he used horses, he could only plough one acre in a whole day. Ploughing is Mr. Farnsworth's most enjoyable job.
